main event: On August 14, 1955, a civilian reported a sighting in Wadena, Minnesota of a balloon-like object moving against the wind, climbing rapidly out of sight. The observation lasted for 40 minutes and the object was described as whitish, flat on top and bottom, and extremely bright.
interesting points: The object was balloon-like, flat on top and bottom, whitish like shiny aluminum, and had a V shape on the bottom.
It had a dark row around the side resembling windows.
The duration of the sighting was deemed too long for a balloon and the object moved against the wind.
Based on the sighting location and description, the conclusion was that the object was a balloon.
The report includes no photographs, and the source of the report was a civilian.
